author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bishop Heber College signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Concordia College, New York, on Thursday envisaging a long-term mutually beneficial relationship.

Students of Bishop Heber College can enrol in an American Transfer Programme (ATP) of academic study at Concordia College, New York, as per the agreement.

On successful completion of the course, students will be conferred undergraduate degrees by Concordia College, New York, in their field of study.

The degrees would be awarded on various subjects including Biology, Business Administration, English, Health Studies, Social Sciences, Liberal Studies, Nursing, and Social Work.

Scholarship

The agreement will facilitate at least 10 students per year to apply for scholarship and other financial aid to study in Concordia College.

Paul Dhayabaran, Principal of Bishop Heber College, and I. Rup Kumar and Ninan Thomas, Indian representatives for Concordia College, New York, were present during the MoU signing function.

J. Godwin Prem Singh and Isaiah Samuelraj of Bishop Heber College were present.
title: Bishop Heber College signs Memorandum of Understanding with New York college
